	Carla blamed Sumner for the fact that Diane was working at Cheers. Sumner left Diane in the very first episode. He said he was going to be right back but never came back until this episode.

questions.text: Who was shooting each other with water pistols?
questions.explanation:
Sam and Diane.

	They had just returned from a date and were still having fun with water pistols. Sam fell down and said she needed to give him mouth to mouth.

questions.text: How long ago did Sumner say he'd be right back?
questions.explanation:
1 year ago.

	Sumner told Diane he'd be gone an hour because he was going to get the wedding ring from his ex-wife. He ended up getting back together with her and therefore never returned for Diane.

Yes.

	Diane said to Sumner, "Sumner, let's cut the crap. You want to be forgiven, you're forgiven." To this Sumner responded, "Cut the crap. What have they done to you?"

Barbara.

	Barbara was never seen, only talked about. She was Sumner's first wife and they got back together when Sumner went to get the ring from her so he could marry Diane.

questions.text: What did Coach tell Sam to talk about?
questions.explanation:
Sam's apartment.

	Coach said that Sam should talk about something only he knew about so he'd appear smart. Sam replied, "No one is going to want to talk about my apartment." And Coach responded, "Of course not, they'd look foolish trying."

options: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
questions.explanation:
War and Peace.

	"War and Peace" was written by Leo Tolstoy. It is one of the biggest novels ever written. Sam who never reads, read it to impress Sumner so he would look good to Diane.

Barbara.

	Barbara and Sumner had broken up but Sumner lied and said they were still together. The truth was he wanted Diane back and was hoping to have dinner alone with her.

questions.correct: He was annoyed that he was not included in any of the night's conversation.
options: He wanted to break up with Diane but didn't know how.
He was constantly insulted by Sumner.
questions.explanation:
He was annoyed that he was not included in any of the night's conversation.

	Part of the conversation was in another language so Sam couldn't participate because he didn't understand. The only time they bothered to talk to Sam was to tell him he was using the wrong fork.

questions.text: Who figured out why Sumner came back?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Sam told Diane that Sumner wanted her back and Sumner confirmed that it was true. Diane said she flipped a coin about coming back to Sam. She said "Heads I'm gonna walk in here to Sam, tails I'm gonna run in here to Sam."
